noun.description: The action of speaking or acting on behalf of someone or the state of being so represented.
examples: asylum-seekers should be guaranteed good legal advice and representation

noun.description: The description or portrayal of someone or something in a particular way or as being of a certain nature.
examples: the representation of women in newspapers

noun.description: Formal statements made to a higher authority, especially so as to communicate an opinion or register a protest.
examples: certain church groups are making strong representations to our government

origin: Late Middle English (in the sense image, likeness): from Old French representation or Latin repraesentatio(n-), from repraesentare bring before, exhibit (see represent).
